member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.Dispatcher
member.summary: Provides methods for invoking functionality on the Main (UI) thread

member.summary: Executes the specified action on the UI thread asynchronously
member.remarks: - Uses Xamarin.Forms Device class to invoke action on the UI thread - void return - fire and forget

member.summary: Gets or sets time interval of Tick event callbacks

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the timer is started or stopped

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.StringExtensions
member.summary: Helper class for providing common cross-platform string manipulations.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.StringExtensions.ToPlainText(System.String)
member.summary: Strips-out html code from text.
member.param: Text that may contain html code.
member.returns: Plain text after html code is removed.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.ThrottleAwaiter
member.summary: The throttle awaiter is useful for limiting the number of times a block of code executes in cases where that code is repeatly called many times within a certain interval, but you only want the code executed once. Awaiting the ThrottleDelay method will delay code continuation until a set interval has elapsed without any other calls to ThrottleDelay on the same instance.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.ThrottleAwaiter.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Milliseconds to throttle.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.ThrottleAwaiter.ThrottleDelay
member.summary: Invokes the throttled delay
member.returns: Task

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.ThrottleAwaiter.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels an in-progress delay interval

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions
member.summary: Provides utility extension methods related to time

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.AddMonths(System.DateTimeOffset,System.Double)
member.summary: Adds the specified number of months to the DateTimeOffset object
member.param: The date to add months to
The number of months to add
member.returns: A DateTimeOffset object with the specified number of months added

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.AddTimeValue(System.DateTimeOffset,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeValue)
member.summary: Adds the specified TimeValue to the DateTimeOffset object
member.param: The date to add the time value to
The amount of time to add
member.returns: A DateTimeOffset object with the specified time added

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.Divide(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeExtent,System.Int32)
member.summary: Divides the specified TimeExtent by the specified number
member.param: The extent to divide
The amount to divide the extent by
member.returns: A TimeValue instance which, will fit evenly into the input TimeExtent the specified number of times

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.IsGreaterThan(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeValue,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeValue)
member.summary: Determines whether a specified TimeValue is greater than another TimeValue instance
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the first TimeValue is greater than the second

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.ToMilliseconds(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeValue)
member.summary: Converts a TimeValue instance to milliseconds
member.param: The TimeValue to convert
member.returns: The TimeValue's equivalent number of milliseconds
member.remarks: If the time value's unit is months or greater, the return value cannot be determined exactly indepedent of a known start or end date. In these cases, a duration of one month is assumed to be (365 / 12) days, and the final value is determined based on that assumption.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.Union(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeExtent,Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeExtent)
member.summary: Merges two TimeExtents together to create one TimeExtent that will encompass both input extents
member.param: The first extent to union
The second extent to union
member.returns: A TimeExtent instance with a start time that is the minimum of the that of the two input extents and an end time that is the maximum of that of the two input extents

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.TimeExtensions.IsTimeInstant(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeExtent)
member.summary: Determines whether the input extent represents instantaneous time
member.param: The time extent to interrogate
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the extent represents an instant in time

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.ScaleLine.ConvertInchesTo(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Geometry.LinearUnit)
member.summary: 1. (target_width_pixels / 96) = target_width_inches 2. target_width_inches * map_scale = map_scale_inches 3. map_scale_inches converted to meters = map_scale_meters
member.returns: value that represents the maps scale in meters

member.remarks: A pixel is a device independent logical pixel - ie 1/96 inches.
member.param: The area which center the scale will be calculated for.

member.returns: The MapScale for the center of the view

member.summary: The TimeSlider is a utility Control that emits TimeExtent values typically for use with the Map Control to enhance the viewing of geographic features that have attributes based upon Date/Time information.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.UpdateTrackLayout(Esri.ArcGISRuntime.TimeExtent)
member.summary: Updates slider track UI components to display the specified time extent
member.param: The time extent to display on the slider track

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.CalculateTextSize(Android.Widget.TextView,System.String)
member.summary: Calculates the size of the specified text using the specified TextBlock's font properites
member.param: The TextBlock to use in the size calculation
The text to calculate the size for. If unspecified, the size of the TextBlock's text will be calculated.
member.returns: The size of the text
member.remarks: This method is useful in cases where a TextBlock's text has updated, but its layout has not. In such cases, the ActualWidth and ActualHeight properties are not representative of the new text.

member.returns: The snapped time extent

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.CalculateTimeSteps
member.summary: Updates time steps based on the current TimeStepInterval and FullExtent. Executes asynchronously to ensure that pending updates to both TimeStepInterval and FullExtent are taken into account before intervals and subsequent layout updates are calculated.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.InitializeTimeSteps(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the time slider to have the specified number of time steps
member.param: The number of time steps
member.remarks:
This method divides the TimeSlider instance's into the number of steps specified, updating the and properties. The method will attempt to set the interval to a TimeValue with the smallest duration and largest time unit that will fit evenly (i.e. without fractional duration values) into the TimeSlider's full extent. If there is no TimeValue that will fit evenly, then the interval will be initialized to the smallest possible fractional duration that is greater than one with a time unit of days or smaller.
Note that, if the TimeSlider instance's FullExtent property is not set, invoking this method will have no effect.

member.name: E:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.CurrentExtentChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the selected time extent has changed.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.StepForward(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the slider position forward by the specified number of time steps.
member.returns: true if succeeded, false if the position could not be moved as requested
member.param: The number of steps to advance the slider's position
member.remarks: When the current time extent represents a time range and neither the start nor end time are pinned, then the number of time steps between the start and end time will always be preserved. In that case, a value of false will be returned if the extent could not be moved by the specified number of time steps without going beyond the end of the time slider's full extent. If the current time extent is a time instant and either the start or end time are pinned, then the method call will attempt to move the unpinned end of the time extent. In that case, the method will return false if the unpinned end could not be moved by the specified number of steps without going beyond the end of the full extent or the pinned end of the current extent. In all cases, when the method returns false, the time slider's current extent will be unchanged.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.StepBack(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the slider position back by the specified number of time steps.
member.returns: true if succeeded, false if the position could not be moved as requested
member.param: The number of steps to advance the slider's position
member.remarks: When the current time extent represents a time range and neither the start nor end time are pinned, then the number of time steps between the start and end time will always be preserved. In that case, a value of false will be returned if the extent could not be moved by the specified number of time steps without going beyond the start of the time slider's full extent. If the current time extent is a time instant and either the start or end time are pinned, then the method call will attempt to move the unpinned end of the time extent. In that case, the method will return false if the unpinned end could not be moved by the specified number of steps without going beyond the start of the full extent or the pinned end of the current extent. In all cases, when the method returns false, the time slider's current extent will be unchanged.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.UI.Controls.TimeSlider.MoveTimeStep(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the current start and end times by the specified number of time steps
member.param: The number of time steps by which to move the current time. A positive number will advance the time step forward, while a negative value will move the current time step backward
Whether to preserve the number of time steps between the current start and end time
member.returns: true if succeeded, false if the time step could not be moved as requested
